verses.kjv: And Israel abode in Shittim, and the people began to commit whoredom with the daughters of Moab.
verses.web: Israel stayed in Shittim; and the people began to play the prostitute with the daughters of Moab;
verses.ct: While Israel was camped at Shittim, the men began sleeping with Moabite women.

verses.kjv: And they called the people unto the sacrifices of their gods: and the people did eat, and bowed down to their gods.
verses.web: for they called the people to the sacrifices of their gods. The people ate and bowed down to their gods.
verses.ct: These women invited the Israelites to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate the sacrificial meals and bowed down to worship those gods.

verses.kjv: And Israel joined himself unto Baalpeor: and the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel.
verses.web: Israel joined himself to Baal Peor, and LORD’s anger burned against Israel.
verses.ct: Israel devoted itself to Baal Peor, and the LORD's anger burned against them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take all the heads of the people, and hang them up before the LORD against the sun, that the fierce anger of the LORD may be turned away from Israel.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Take all the chiefs of the people, and hang them up to LORD before the sun, that the fierce anger of LORD may turn away from Israel.”
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Take all the leaders of the people who are guilty and execute them in broad daylight before the LORD, so that my fierce anger will turn away from Israel."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the judges of Israel, Slay ye every one his men that were joined unto Baalpeor.
verses.web: Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Everyone kill his men who have joined themselves to Baal Peor.”
verses.ct: So Moses told the judges of Israel, "Each of you must put to death every man under your authority who has devoted himself to Baal Peor."

verses.kjv: And, behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought unto his brethren a Midianitish woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, who were weeping before the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.web: Behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought to his brothers a Midianite woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, while they were weeping at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: Right then, in plain sight of Moses and the entire Israelite community — while they were weeping at the entrance of the Tabernacle — an Israelite man brazenly brought a Midianite woman to his family.

verses.kjv: And when Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from among the congregation, and took a javelin in his hand;
verses.web: When Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from the middle of the congregation, and took a spear in his hand.
verses.ct: When Phinehas son of Eleazar, the grandson of Aaron the priest, saw this, he jumped up from the crowd and grabbed a spear.

verses.kjv: And he went after the man of Israel into the tent, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her belly. So the plague was stayed from the children of Israel.
verses.web: He went after the man of Israel into the pavilion, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her body. So the plague was stopped among the children of Israel.
verses.ct: He followed the Israelite man into the tent and drove the spear through both of them — through the man and through the woman's body. Immediately, the plague that had been striking Israel stopped.

verses.kjv: And those that died in the plague were twenty and four thousand.
verses.web: Those who died by the plague were twenty-four thousand.
verses.ct: By then, 24,000 people had already died from the plague.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, hath turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, while he was zealous for my sake among them, that I consumed not the children of Israel in my jealousy.
verses.web: “Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, in that he was jealous with my jealousy among them, so that I didn’t consume the children of Israel in my jealousy.
verses.ct: "Phinehas son of Eleazar, grandson of Aaron the priest, has turned my wrath away from the Israelites. He was as jealous for my honor among them as I am, so I didn't destroy them all in my jealousy.

verses.kjv: Wherefore say, Behold, I give unto him my covenant of peace:
verses.web: Therefore say, ‘Behold, I give to him my covenant of peace.
verses.ct: Because of this, tell him: I am giving him my covenant of peace.

verses.kjv: And he shall have it, and his seed after him, even the covenant of an everlasting priesthood; because he was zealous for his God, and made an atonement for the children of Israel.
verses.web: It shall be to him, and to his offspring after him, the covenant of an everlasting priesthood, because he was jealous for his God, and made atonement for the children of Israel.’ ”
verses.ct: He and his descendants after him will hold the covenant of an everlasting priesthood, because he was zealous for his God and made atonement for the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: Now the name of the Israelite that was slain, even that was slain with the Midianitish woman, was Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a chief house among the Simeonites.
verses.web: Now the name of the man of Israel that was slain, who was slain with the Midianite woman, was Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a fathers’ house among the Simeonites.
verses.ct: The Israelite man who was killed along with the Midianite woman was Zimri son of Salu, a leader of a prominent family in the tribe of Simeon.

verses.kjv: And the name of the Midianitish woman that was slain was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur; he was head over a people, and of a chief house in Midian.
verses.web: The name of the Midianite woman who was slain was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur. He was head of the people of a fathers’ house in Midian.
verses.ct: The Midianite woman who was killed was Cozbi daughter of Zur, who was the head of a prominent clan in Midian.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to Moses,

verses.kjv: Vex the Midianites, and smite them:
verses.ct: "Treat the Midianites as enemies and attack them,

verses.kjv: For they vex you with their wiles, wherewith they have beguiled you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of a prince of Midian, their sister, which was slain in the day of the plague for Peor’s sake.
verses.web: for they harassed you with their wiles, wherein they have deceived you in the matter of Peor, and in the incident regarding Cozbi, the daughter of the prince of Midian, their sister, who was slain on the day of the plague in the matter of Peor.”
verses.ct: because they treated you as enemies first. They used their schemes to deceive you — through the incident at Peor and through Cozbi, the daughter of a Midianite leader, who was killed on the day the plague broke out because of what happened at Peor."
